review: We visited Palm Desert for the day on Saturday after a trip to Salvation Mountain.  Palm Desert in general was pretty dead around 3pm on the particular day we visited.  We don't really know the area too well, so we ended up selecting this CPK for late lunch/early dinner. We ended up selecting a table by the bar area, it was semi outdoors.  I am not sure if this business we be considered pet friendly, so I would call ahead to check first. The food was the usual CPK food.  I opted for a pizza and my husband selected a pasta dish.  Food quality was good, though I think my Five Cheese Pizza was perhaps missing a few of the cheeses.  We split the Butter Cake for desert, which is amazing!  Our server was pretty good about checking on us and providing refills. Overall a decent experience.

Got a gift card to CPK and it was the first time I went! Glad to now have experienced it! Delicious food and drinks and excellent, friendly service. We had pizza and I had a refreshing and tasty watermelon mint martini! I'd definitely go back again!

My dad and I usually get the Asian chicken salad + avocado egg rolls. We decided to try something new I ordered the roasted veggie salad and was worried about the Dijon vinaigrette but was delicious with the great mix of colorful veggies including artichoke hearts, bell peppers, and eggplant. My dad got the bbq chicken salad and was particularly disappointed initially with the flavor but added some ranch and all was good!

This location was within walking distance from the condo we had rented for 5 months this year. We had heard good things about it but had never gone. We probably would go for lunch next time as it was really busy but the food was very good. My husband had the Carne Asada pizza and I had the veggie pizza. Both were amazing. We took a lot of it home for late night snacks but had to try the salted caramel pudding~~~ sinfully good !!!! Next time we try the pastas.

Just had dinner at CPK, and the food is just aweful! Super salty but tasteless! Only went here because I had a gift card. Ordered a red zinfandel wine and it was sweet. Said 7:99 on menu but charged me 8 99 on the check. My guy had chicken picatta and it was salty and tasted nothing like chicken picatta! Menu said 15.99 and we goylt charged 16:99.  I had pesto and could not hardly eat it. Salad was bland and boring! Do yourself a favor and eat some where else! Lots of fabulous restaurants on El Paseo!

I love California Pizza Kitchen and for the first time ever I was actually craving it so my boyfriend and I went to the El Paseo Gardens to go to our favorite restaurant! Our food came in nice and warm and they were delicious but I felt like we are so high maintenance on our drink that our server kept forgetting to refill my water and my bf's soda and he wanted to get his money's worth on that. Overall service was okay I guess she was training but I just hoped I was assisted by another server name Ashley. She was right next to the station of our other server and she was very attentive to all her tables and I wish we had her as our server. Maybe next time we'll request her!

Ive never written a review befor but i feel compelled to because of such consistant food and great service . Ive always loved the food at CPK but i must say i really go to this location because of the service and experience i get here. Theres some amazingly hard working individuals that make me return time and time again. Betty is so great if you want alot of interaction, shes always smiling and you really want to get to know her. Ashley gives amazing speedy service..again another smiling face. Karissa is such a rock star in the bar. Derek could be running the place and makes a killer drink. By the way the specialty drinks here are so interesting and fresh. Always something new to try. Taylor was a manager when i went in and man does that girl have spunk, so passionate about her career .i ordered curb side due to my 18 month old being in the car with me and nicole had it out to me in less than 5 min. I mean really.. This place is full of amazing individuals that bring soo much to the hospitality industry and ill keep coming back for more. Cpk in palm desert kicks ass woooo

Miguel immediately seated us. Lorena make sincere effort to get our order right, and explain the menu items. Soup, salad, pizza, dumplings, drinks and dessert were all delicious. Manager Jesse checked on our party, and was very pleasant. Good value for such high-quality food. Regards, Andy Gregg, Palm Springs.

The food is always fresh and hot. Staff is very nice and attentive. Manager comped our food because it didn't come out on time. We didn't complain she just offered. Service is beyond exceptional. I've eaten at other Cpk's and this is the best one. They care about their service and the waiters try hard to please.
The service at this CPK is terrible! The hosts last night were some of the rudest people I have ever encountered. If your looking for a a place on El Paseo, skip this place, you can do better.

We typically get takeout from here so I can't really speak to dining in.  If you've ever eaten at a CPK you know what to expect.  It's a chain so the overall quality is standard at all the locations I've been to.  Typical order is 3-4 pizzas and a salad and as usual the food was delicious. I just wish their pizza offerings hadn't been so downsized over the years.  So many wonderful pizza's that I used to order are gone now.  If they touch my Jamaican jerk chicken (which fortunately you can still get on regular crust if you ask) I may have to bid them farewell.

One of the best lunches I've had in a long time! The Mediterranean salad was light and delicious. The California pizza was also perfect! Service was good, drinks were great! Can't wait for the next visit!

I was worried after I read the reviews. This Friday they have awesome service. Did not way for my drink from the bar. Bella the waitress was amazing. Food was perfect!!! Thanks!!! Rib eye and pizza is delicious.

Great , friendly service at the bar. Ordered a Thai Chicken original crust pizza and a garlic chicken Nuggets him crust pizza. Both were presented steaming hot very good absolutely no complaints. Good service good food will definitely be back

We're not from around this location. We got here on a Sat and looked reasonably open. We were sat immediately, and bread was brought timely.  Michelle was our waitress, and took her time getting to us. We ordered water to drink since it was hot outside, and it took a long time to get it. 3 other tables were seated after us, and their drinks were delivered before ours.  We finally ordered. Cedar plank salmon, Mahi mahi tacos and a kids pepperoni pizza.  Again the three tables sat after us were brought their food before ours. Once we got it, the salmon was overcooked and the mahi mahi tacos were had little mahi in them.  Overall, i would not go to this location again, nor recommend it to anybody.

We've been coming here for years and there are too many great waitresses to single one out .  For repeat customers who come in and don't have to pick up a menu, it's pretty cool. My wife and I sat down at the bar the other night and Marsella asked if I wanted to same bottle of Zin that I ordered 3 weeks prior.  Who does this?!?! Marsella , Jen, Ashley.... They're all wonderful and the food is always good. If you're in the area, give it a shot!

No Soup for You!  Sloooow. Acting on impulse while out shopping, I phoned in a takeout order for a couple of serving of my favorite Tortilla Soup. A very pleasant young woman told me it would be some 18 minutes before it would be ready. No problem - being around the corner, I would run an errand first. I showed up 20 minutes after the order. No soup. 25 minutes... still no soup. 35 minutes after the order, it was filled. Explanation: it takes 30 minutes to warm up the soup. Careful, my friends. When next you visit California Pizza Kitchen, it may be "No Soup for You!!!"

Out of town, came to CPK because I love pizza and I know I would have a great time anywhere I go visit family and there's a CPK near the area. So we made plans to have dinner at this CPK in El Paseo, we were greeted nicely and offered my family a table within 5 min. Our server immediately brought us bread and butter and was patient with us because we were still waiting on one more family member. Considering that a bigger group came in after us, when the last family member arrived I was impressed how fast our food came to us from the time she took our order to the time she brought the other table their drinks. We never felt pushed to finish, she even offered us dessert which we did. I ordered my usual Pepperoni Pizza, A combination of rustic and spicy pepperoni with fresh Mozzarella and wild oregano. + White Truffle Oil For dessert I had the Chocolate Soufflé, hot chocolate cake topped with ice cream on the top, a delicious combination in your mouth of hot and cold.  Last but not least the quality of the food, the taste of the meals and the price, all were right on point, happy to say so far that CPK has not disappointed me at anytime or at any location whether it is in my hometown or out of town I can always count on them. A++++ (5 Stars to them)  Great Job!
It actually closes at 10 pm, very unfortunate since we drove all the way from Palm Springs with two hungry kids on Saturday night. The person at the door was extremely rude. Wow very disappointing

We came here for lunch after admittedly the daily grill had too long a wait. We were greeted cheerfully and seated promptly. The highlight was our waitress whose name I regret I can't remember. The food was pretty good too. There were 4 of us and we shared various salads and flatbreads. Very tasty and well priced. Nice ambiance at least for lunch. It's nice to go to a restaurant with not only quality food but appreciative staff who didn't rush us, even at the busy lunch hour. Will definitely be back.

Oh boy! this place was a disaster. We went with 6 kids and three adults. The kids were doing really well but with the place empty (we missed the lunch rush) why no one would help us beyond me. Well, finally we ordered and all our orders were messed up (the 3 adults). We decided to take it anyway but they insisted on bringing the right plates. Then we get the check and they've comped our wrong orders? Well obviously I wasn't going to pay for that! It was all a mess but really, when your place is empty and there is such a big group with kids, why lag? Not happy with the service here at all. It's just that it's Palm Desert and there aren't much choices for semi-kid friendly places.

I was out on a job walk with two clients at the Big Horn Country club and after we finished I suggested lunch at CPK. This CPK is located on swanky El Paseo drive and we parked across the street. Once we arrived we were seated within minutes. Our waitress was friendly and took our drink orders asap. I went with the fish tacos and added slices of  creamy avocado and chips and salsa were served with the two tacos. My tacos were large and definitely were filling and went great with my strawberry lemonade. My clients hadn't been too CPK in years and they were both satisfied with their entrees also. For being a big box chain - CPK provides consistent quality food with a diverse menu.

I have gotten take out 2 times in the last month from here and the young girl who they have doing it needs to be trained better. She is not efficient at all nor can she handle too much at one time. She becomes very frazzled and than forgets half of the orders. I had to remind her what I had and than she still forgot. The gentleman who was waiting for his order as well was very frustrated with her. She came out to give him his order and forgot the drinks, he had to ask her for them and than she took forever to get them to him. I only ordered a salad and a kids meal and it took forever. They need to train her better and get her some assistance when its busy.
Have been back a few times since my review and my spinach artichoke dip with whole wheat pita has been fab every time!!
Pizza was great. Different and we always enjoy it. But the price of a glass of wine is way out of line. Almost as much as a pizza. We still go there but no more wine.

Visited on May 27 at 3 pm we were a party of 12+ for my daughters 17th birthday.  Service was the best!! When we got in the car afterwards, the first thing my daughter commented on was how nice the server was to her and her friends!!  Thank you!!  Of course the kids loved the food which is why we choose CPK, everything was spot on and everyone's meal was great.  In addition a round of 5 different desserts were ordered and those were a huge hit as well.  Perfect after school celebration....good food, good service & good friends!

The original California Club with Iceberg lettuce and lightly done is absolutely phenomenal. Several pizzas on the menu are solid. The avocado egg rolls are just amazing!  The strawberry lemonade is one of the best around, but I can't order because I'm slamming the $3 Ultras at the bar! 18oz pour so a tremendous value! Hell Geah!
Pizza served cold. Ceaser salad stuffs were old and bad quality and waiter was very slow!!! The worst california pizza kitchen ever

Celebrating my boyfriends birthday at this cpk was not that great ! They were busy  The waiter literally spilled the water on me it was very unpleasant and the food was late they didn't even bring out the bread ! Food is good but service sucked!

Our family always comes here and enjoys doing so. Never have we had a bad experience with the food. The only reason this place gets 4 stars is because the customer service isn't great. Everytime we come something gets messed up, whether it be forgeting an order, or a drink. Sometimes very minor things, but still we haven't had a time here go perfect! I still plan on coming and will urge friends to also.

My family and I ate at this location last Saturday and what a disappointment. The server was horrible. Don't know if he was new but he could not multitask. Took almost 25 min just to get bread brought to our table. Finally, dinner arrived and all was going well until a black hair was found in one of our pasta dishes. That sealed the deal on a horrible experience. It's a shame as we have eaten there before with no problems. Hoping for their sake this kind of service doesn't continue.

Came from Los Angeles yesterday and decided to have lunch at CPK on El paseo where my wife and I have eaten many times before. What a mistake!!!! First the hostess decided to put us in the back.  We ordered one Chinese chicken salad and one other salad. Both were awful. We both exchanged them with a Thai salad and another. Same results.  The salads used to be so much better.  Never again on el paseo.

The customer service here is great. Food is a bit pricey, but worth it if you're not on a budget. Their margherita pizza is to die for! The spinach artichoke dip is great as well. Great atmosphere and pretty good beer selection too! I've eaten here a few times a month for the last few years and have had no complaints at all. Definitely recommend it.

CPK is a good family friendly restaurant that offers specialty pizzas and delicious salads. Kid friendly options available like Mac and cheese (my teenage son's fav).  CPK took on a facelift and the restaurant looks modern with clean lines. The kitchen is open which is fun to watch your pizza being made. Enjoy

They have really upgraded this location since I last visited a few years ago.  Very classy and they have a bar area which is awesome.  Excellent service by everyone (you can tell they are well trained) and the food was prompt, fresh and hot.  I am a big fan of their Gorgonzola pizza and salads are excellent too.  We had our whole family 8 people there and everyone was happy and they can be a bit picky so they get 5 stars.
Redemption after Wolfgang Pucks & fraction of the cost! Delicious gluten free pizza (ask then to make it "well done"!

I hadn't been to a CPK since the 1980's - even though there have been a couple of them close to me all these years. Because they are constructing one 200 yards from my office (where El Cholo recently closed), I decided we would try this one out while here in Palm Desert. Unfortunately, it reminded me of why I avoided CPK for almost 30 years.  The four of us each ordered the lunch pizza with soup or salad. My pepperoni and sausage pizza had almost nothing on it. One of the 4 slices had no pepperoni on it, and there were 5 pieces of sausage on the whole pizza. The pepperoni was paper thin and chewed like cardboard. Cheese was minimal. The Caesar salad was very mediocre - something I would expect to get at Taco Bell (where I don't eat). And they gave the tiniest little container of dressing that was 1/4th what it should have been. The service was so so - never sure who our waiter was. 8 minutes after being seated I had to ask for a waiter.

CPK has been one of our long standing favorites, in Corte Madera, San Francisco and Palm Desert. The Palm Desert location has always been the best.  Great pizzas, flavorful doughs snd sauces, unique selections/creations (Sicilian is my favorite, minus the sausage; it's thin crust, so good!), great menu, salads are yummy, offers food to go, can pre-order on Internet.. and a nice selection of appetizers. We've been coming to the PD location since they opened  Always consistent and reliable. Giving 4 stars only because sometime during 2013-2014, they remodeled, modified the menu, made a huge bar area.. compromising what ambience it did have. They have changed their biz model, focusing less on pizza and more on other diner type foods and booze. ter mm zixo vprSo, we just preorder and pick up, as we don't like to gubmo ibside anymore. They are fewer people in there than usual lately,  so not sure if people are liking the changes.  Service has  always good,  and the cooksdekubu accommodate special requests too. They have new competition wvith Stuft Pizza, but we loveboth.Buti

The food was good, the service was a bit rude. We were there on a Friday night around 8:30, maybe she had enough of the busy crowd. The man sitting beside up went to the men's room and when he came back his table was cleared and he had not even paid his check !!! He was very upset.

Went to a birthday lunch here and noticed the place had been remodeled (guess it's been awhile). Anyway, it looked really nice but as you try to access the restroom, you realize that the walkways are way too narrow. Even when you walk to your table from lobby, you must "squish" to get anywhere in there! Bummer but the food was good and our service even better!!! Our waitress was Michelle and she terrific!!! She was very accommodating & super friendly and even got us a free birthday dessert :)  We enjoyed our lunch there...loved the baja & Thai rolls and of course...their key lime pie!!!

Tonight was not a good experience at CPK.  My food was cold the first time and the amount of chicken give was not even a full chicken breast size.  Which was $19.  They brought out a 2nd dish and this time the chicken was over cooked and so rubbery.  We were over charged on our bill. Everything that could go wrong did tonight.  Super sad cause we love this place.  Manager never came over and nobody even cared about the poor experience

We are locals and eat here on a semi-regular basis.  It was our Anniversary and we had a gift card from the restaurant, so we decided we should use it.  My husband made a reservation and told them it was our anniversary.  I called before we arrived to make sure we would get a booth.  A very surly hostess said "we're very busy....I don't know if we can get you a booth."  We get there and the restaurant is half empty, so the booth is no problem. After a long wait, the waiter comes over.  We try to order prime rib and he says they are out of it.  Okay.  We order something else and it arrives in 3 minutes .  My husband had asked them to bring a dessert for our anniversary, but that didn't happen, either.  We paid the bill. On the way out, I complained to the manager.  He became abusive.   I will never eat here again.  This place needs new managemen

We waited for our appetizers and it came out very late as the same time of our main course but the manager i didnt get his name but he gave us an amazing customer service,  he waived off our apps and the kids meal!!!! Now i have not seen this customer service in a long time!!!

Am not a huge fan of their pizza, never was. When I am in the mood for a good salad, which is rare...I come here for their BBQ Chicken Salad, one of the best salads I have ever had. The portion size is good as well, usually get the full size, good enough. Also, the customer service is excellent, have never had a bad experience with the service here. Everyone who works here is generally very friendly.

Our server was buried when we arrived so a runner took our order. Thankfully they have a team approach here. We enjoyed the Flatbread, Dumplings and Lettuce Wraps while the tikes INHALED the personal pizzas. We had a GREAT lunch. It was kind of busy which was a surprise.
service was not good.. Asked for medium spicy spaghettini..instead they made 8/10...the waiter didn't say anything and walked away. So glad o don't leave near this CPK!

This cpk is the worst ever. If they hired a new manager after this first event, they need to fire another one.... I thought i wrote review couple years ago about ordering for pickup, waiting 90 mins with 3 year old in car. (since they never brought our food to pick up spot)  Kept calling and they said 'be right out' ya right. Finally went in and there was line i waited an hour in b/c i had already paid by card so had to wait anyways. cold food. bad.  I think they gave me 20% off. whoopee. HOWEVER,   Recently my family had salad from cpk via a food truck at an event. All sick. In fact many people at event were sick and the cpk salad was culprit. I was thinking that i would find more reviews on here regarding this event that happened last week, but they are all probably still too sick to write about it. Stay tuned.

I am a regular patron at CPK.  I just dined there today.  The food is always excellent.  I do want to give a shout out to Derrick.  He is always awesome!  Betty is awesome as well!  It is always nice to walk in and they both welcome me with a smile.  I always get excellent service from both of Derrick and Betty.  They both have great attitudes and it is always nice to chat with them!

I'm changing my review from 3 stars to 1 star. I went to dinner there on Friday, February 19, with 2 family members. We sat at the bar and it took the bartender (who had super long hair, which wasn't pulled back and kept getting in her way) about 10 minutes to get more menus. She barely asked us if we wanted drinks. She didn't just naturally give us water, we had to ask. She rudely asked for my ID, I told her I wasn't drinking, she gave me a nasty look and said "I still have to check." I understand you have to check, but there's a nicer way to handle things. When food came, they didn't give us silverware, so we asked for some. A blonde girl slammed silverware down in front of us and didn't even hand it out to each of us individually. It seemed that the bartenders there were more concerned about making drinks for the entire restaurant than helping the people around them. We saw other people ask for water, the bill, more drinks, but the bartenders would ignore their request and just focus on the task they were working on at that moment. I will not be coming back to this CPK. There are way better restaurants on El Paseo with way better customer service. It's a shame the nice bar area is going to waste at this place.

My husband and I walk in on Sunday at 2 pm and chose to sit at the bar. The waitress flies by and throws the menus on our table. She comes back. takes our drink and food order. She comes back with 2 lemonades 2 totally wet straws. Returns again and throws bread plate on table so roughly bread falls off plate on table. The 2 bread plates are dirty. i got clean straws from the bar. she replaced bread and breadplates. The actual food was good but what kind of service is this? The place wasn't even busy.
I like some its pizzas but there're expensive too. Unless my parents pay for the bill, I don't go.

Recently came here with a co-worker. I ordered the Jamaican jerk pizza and my co-worker ordered the sea bass plank. He loved his, but my pizza was terrible! I cannot emphasize that enough. It was rubbery and you could only taste the sweet sauce. Honestly I didn't even know if there was any cheese on it. Pretty much never coming back for food. However, the service was good and they had an okay beer selection.

Love CPK. Came today and it was a little busy. Told wait time was 20 mins but it was shorter   Had a friendly server but she wasn't quite up to par. Saw a man in a grey chef's shirt and he was checking his phone. He then shredded Parmesan into a little bowl and touched the cheese with his fingers.  I didn't see him wash after touching is phone.  My dish wasn't how it is usually made and the general manager came by to let me know they were remaking it. The manager also offered to take the cost of the pasta off the check which I appreciated but declined to the dismay of my wife. The remade dish was delicious. And I didn't want to take advantage. Love CPK and will continue to come here.

Not a huge fan of CPK in general, but overall I would rate them a 3 star restaraunt. Why the 1 star you ask? Well, we were vacationing with the family on New Year's Eve and wanted to go out for dinner. We tried calling Cheesecake Factory, Olive Garden, Islands, etc, and they were all either closed or had an hour+ wait. I called CPK, and to our delight, I was told by the woman on the phone that "no, we do not have any wait, and we'll be open our regular hours, we close at 10 pm." It was 905 at this time. So all 15 of us got in our cars, loaded up all the kids, car seats, strollers, etc and went to CPK.  When we got to the front door, the doors were locked. There was only one party in the dining area, and the rest were all employees just staring at us. No one came to the door or even motioned to us. So I called the number again and it was the same lady that answered the phone. She said "oh yeah, my GM called me right after you called and told me that we are going to close at 930." I told her that that really sucks because we drove all the way out here with 4 cars and the kids are tired and starving, and she said "oh come in and I'll give you free food vouchers." I told her I wasn't interested and hung up. That was the worst customer service experience I have ever had. She tried justifying it that her GM didn't even let them know earlier and that it was just her second day back to work. She wasn't apologetic and didn't really care how that affected me and my family. She was just going on and on about how her GM didn't even give them a heads up. We ended up going to Red Lobster down the road and had a pleasant time. Mark my word, I will never visit any CPK...EVER!
I like to come and have lunch here with my mom. We usually share out pizzas and salad. Must try: -wild mushroom pizza -pear Gorgonzola pizza -Waldorf chicken salad

Cpk has a nice location at a corner on El Paseo.  After going to most of the restaurants that specialize in pizza in the Valley, this place doesn't have the quality or value that makes this place worth repeat business.  Their gluten-free crust is probably the first example I've ever come to realize what eating cardboard really means. Every pizza costs around $17-20 and is only a personal size pizza.. (10" inches) You can get the exact same pizza out of the freezer at a store for $6 and realize why it's only $6. I don't think you get the quality for value here. It's all very cliche basic food that isn't anything great.  CPK is basically like a nicer Applebee's

Really crappy service from ALL workers. My boyfriend and I are visiting from San Diego and had ISRAEL as our server. We haven't been in years and we went over the menu and figured out what we wanted and sat for a good 15 minutes before Israel ever came over to greet us or to take our drink orders. We literally were starring down servers to figure out who was ours and the menus were put away. We looked ready to order... The worst part- the place was empty. He took our order and brought us bread, and then we didn't see him for a while. He didn't even bring out our food. Our drinks sat empty for a long time and it took about 5-10 more minutes after he asked if he wanted refills to actually bring the refills. There were about 10 workers and they cared more about having fun and joking with each other. They were standing around, joking, and counting their tips in front of all of us.  One customer had a baby and was upset that her food was taking too long and tried to leave and no one even care for her. It was sad to watch. The food didn't even taste that good. The soda was the best part... I'm just extremely bummed about the service. The place was dead and there was no reason for bad service. Servers, especially Israel, were slow and didn't seem to care.

The food was great! Our server Jenn was great!  But then they sat a couple with a barking snarling dog right next to us!  It was not a service dog.  It barked and snarled through the last half of our lunch.  I couldn't wait to leave.

We live close to CPK on El Paseo and walked up for dinner about a month ago.  There were several dirty tables and the hostess told us it would be a 20 minute wait so we went elsewhere.  This past weekend I was very apprehensive about trying again, but I'm glad we did.  Our server was Jenni and she knocked it out of the park.  The food was great and the service and team work was exceptional.  They turned a quick bite to eat into a great dining experience.  Jenni and her colleagues made a return customer out of me.

I've been to this location several times over the years, and the remodel looks fantastic! Glass enclosed bar gave the restaurant a much-needed modern update.  Came here last night for dinner with the hubs, and our server Jesse was superb. He was genuinely friendly, attentive, and extended the same level of 5 star service to his whole section. He was busy, but always smiling! I ordered the BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad with sliced avocado, and the mister devoured his Pepperoni, Sausage and Mushroom pizza. Because I'm currently expecting, I sipped on a non-alcoholic strawberry mango cooler - very refreshing!  Had a great time - yummy food and excellent service. Thanks Jesse!

This place has got it all right. As you walk in, the decor catches your eye and it is noticeably clean inside. Pleasant waitstaff greet and seat you. Your drink order is taken and complementary bread is brought over with oil to dip.  Once food is ordered, it is brought out quickly and is so delicious. We particularly love the salads- the BBQ chicken and the Italian Chop to be specific. My mom and her husband frequent this restaurant and the pizzas and dinner entrees are also loved by them. I had a Moscow Mule- my favorite alcoholic drink- and it was pure perfection! It had a lime wedge and shaved ginger in it- what a fresh and flavorful twist. I highly recommend it. To top it off, the waitstaff is incredibly kind, patient and detail oriented.  California Pizza kitchen has prices on the higher side, but you really get what pay for in the food and overall quality experience.

Exactly what my star rating means. A- OK. Here are the pros and cons of my dining experience at California Pizza Kitchen. The location and convenience. It is located on El Paseo towards the west end. This leaves for prime parking and walking to other shops around El Paseo if you want to walk off that pizza you just ate (Just saying because that is exactly what my mom and I did). Its easy to find and its surrounded by great shopping.  Inside. It is nice and welcoming inside. I also have to mention that the lighting is pretty decent. Just putting that in there if you wanted to capture the moment. It was clean and inviting. The bar area is secluded and away from the rest of the "normal" dining area. Note- for happy hour you have to be sitting in the bar area. Our waiter also mentioned that the happy hour is not out of this world. So pass.  Our service. Our waiter was accommodating, especially because we had a hungry baby sitting with us. She waited on our every request and was very nice. Also gave us great recommendations. The waiting time for our appetizers wasnt too bad. The waiting for the rest of our other food was longer than we anticipated. I get it though because it was a packed house...  The food. It was a okay. The appetizers we had were the spring rolls or something of the sort and they were pretty good. Though i dont know why people rave about the thai chicken pizza so much. We got that and I didnt like it very much. It wasnt what I was hoping for and I'd wish we tried something else. The ceseaer salad was okay but I dont expect it to be something out of this world. Everything was just ok. I'd go back if I had to but not for choice.

Best customer service in the Coachella Valley!! Colette our waitress hands down handiling like a boss!! Very busy but all the employees served with a smile!!The manager was awesome, she served me an amaizing sample for my first visit!! If your looking for great food and phenomenal customer service this is the place!!  Sanchez Fam !
Great staff and kid friendly. Food is a B+ but healthy. Service good. I would come for lunch special salads are filling.

This was our fall back choice since there was an hour wait at Daily Grill across the street.   My friend and I decided to split the Thai salad with chicken and a pepperoni and mushroom thin crust pizza.   The Thai salad came. out first.  It's one of my favorite salads on the menu.  We thought the pizza would come out with the salad.  We finish the salad.  Wait.  Wait.  Wait. Ask our waiter what the status is on our pizza.  "It'll be right out."  Wait.  Wait.  No pizza.  Ask AGAIN!  Then finally after about a half hour finishing our salad, the pizza arrives.  Finish the pizza.  Waiter no where to be found to get our bill.  Really?!  Terrible service even when it wasn't very crowded.

Quality of the food is just like any other California Pizza Kitchen (4/5 stars), however, the service is what makes this place stand out. Waitresses stop by to make sure you're doing okay every 5-10 minutes. Super thoughtful. Quick to bring anything extra you ask for. 5 cheese pizza is BOMB. Salads are crispy and fresh. The desserts all look delicious, but we were too full to order one because we got extra food on the house. That's right! First time guests get an extra treat (some sort of sample, depending on the day). 10/10 would recommend.

I've tried over and over to give CPK the benefit of the doubt about all the errors that have occured while dealing with them but i can not overlook them any longer. My co-workers and I TRY to continue ordering from them but without FAIL something goes wrong. I just had a terrible experience with them today regarding their option to pick a to go order up  CURB SIDE. Why is it called Curb side if i have to go inside to sort out the confusion. They gave us our food for free, again today which is great but now that i think about it.. I've never paid for my food there BECAUSE THEY ARE ALWAYS SCREWING SOMETHING UP. It is more trouble than it's worth to deal with them. I RESEND my previous review and would not recommend them to anyone. Maybe you will have an okay experience if you dine in but do NOT try to place an order for pick up because they haven't mastered that yet.... RIDICULOUS

In the past I thought CPK was never that okay but oh my god I happened to come here and everything is seriously amazing from the service to the food. They serve bread and amazing oil for everyone and the Shishito peppers are so addicting every dish i got for dinner has been amazing. My favorite being the tequila fettuccine. CPK has never disappointed in this location amazing service and always amazing food trust me you won't regret.

Good service friendly and prompt!love the salad menu here!great location on pricey El Paseo it's good food fresh and not bland like so many chain food restaurant experience that always disappoint until you load it with salt and pepper! I haven't eaten here in years and it was a surprise to find it on El Paseo while looking  to park after gallery visits

Went there for my birthday several days ago. It was a terrible experience and I probably will not go back. First of all it was so noisy we could not even hear waitress talk to us. All she did is laugh because of the noise. Secondly the pizza I ordered was not the one I received at the table. I could not get her attention to get another pizza. It certainly has change for the worse.

The fish taco are excellent.  Cobb salad is very good.  The half size is more than enough.  We ate in the restraint  one day and service was great.  Today we ate in the bar and the service was fun and excellent as well as the food.

Understandable having to wait 35 minutes for a table on a busy Saturday afternoon - it was our decision to stay.  However, we did not know that it would be another half hour just to get some waters and iced tea, and a total of 45 minutes before we could order - that is after we finally got the attention of another waiter asking if he could find our waitress.  Getting refills on water - and iced tea that they charge $4 for was impossible.  Ate our meals without anything to drink - that is unacceptable.  For the amount of staff at the PD CPK, there is no reason everything should have taken so long - even getting our check.  Food was meh - we can get what we ate anywhere, and with better service.  Definitely will not be back.

Mixed bag. We really liked our server, but they were understaffed the night we were there and it took a long time for our cocktails to arrive. That said, when they did arrive (Moscow Mules) they were quite good. I tried the Carne Asade Pizza from the seasonal menu and it was good. Probably not good enough to order again, but tasty. The best pizza at the table was the garlic chicken pizza. The worst was the margarita--the crust was kind of soggy. There's parking in back, and they have happy hour 'til 6pm if you're an early bird...

CPK is a hip and groovy place to chow down, some real interesting bites! I can't but help to continually ordering the Chicken Tequila Fehttuchini because it is just so different and extremely flavorful and even has a bit of a kick. Definitely a dish you will find no other place on earth, I am quite certain of this. Ron had the California Cobb Salad served on a platter, wow that was some portion!  Our waiter Israel was super pleasant and really on the ball with our table. He pays attention to the details which I can say so very few servers now a day really do not comprehend or have never been served by someone who does!  I ordered the Petite Wedge Salad which also was very good, but in my opinion what dinged CPK from a perfect experience and meal was the the food runner brought our main dish out before I could even take two bites out of my wedge! One thing that really irks me is running courses prematurely or running them too slow. Pay attention to the pace in which your patrons are eating, this will give you a clue when it is the right time to bring the next course or suggest dessert. This was not Israel's fault but the speed at which the kitchen and runners are working in team.  One word of advice I have is to be careful if you charge your meal; pay careful attention to your  bill for on it is a line right above the tip line to offer a donation to RoundUp4Charity. Now I have no problem with any establishment soliciting donations from their guests to support charities, but we did not see one blurb in either the menu on the table or mentioned by our server or hostess about it. Come on CPK what's up with this?

I don't know where to start- I took my dear client here after showing a fair amount of homes. Jacque was excited to go have pizza and salad. Well, I did the ordering. We were excited to get the food. Our server, Gio, was super sweet. Sadly, he forgot about us. Our food came. California club pizza and a southwest salad. The pizza as ok, not great! The salad had less than 2 tablespoons of chicken on it. At $15 for a big salad. Come on.  I like 2 eat pizza at reputable or hole-in-the-wall places. I don't think I'll be going back to California Pizza Kitchen

Bread was good That was all, saw our food sitting waiting to be taken to us for a solid 10 minutes. Got the food (Mac and cheese) pasta was stale and barely any sauce. Not sure if because they didn't put a lot of sauce on or because of it sitting for so long. Service was OK didn't really see our waiter that often. All in all probably not gonna come back. Unacceptable

Still love CPK and the food does not disappoint. I wish the prices were lower or they brought back the lunch menu specials under $10 but food is consistently good! Our waitress, Sheila, was delightful! She went above and beyond ( even brought me a much needed note paper and tape for my open house) and was efficient and understanding of our time crunch as my husband and I had to be at work! My chopped salad was fantastic and my husband ate all of his California Cobb pizza! Thank you, Sheila and CPK!!

I ordered 3 full Thia chicken salads and 1 half order for takeout. My total was over $70. For 3 1/2 salads...ridiculous!  There wasn't enough salad dressing and the Chinese noodles were hard as rocks. Chicken was very fatty/chewy. Overall, it was terrible and if I received this salad in the restaurant I would have returned it! Yuck!!!

Tonight felt like a scene from a horror movie. We chose CPK like a safety blanket as our 3-hour commute then shopping extravaganza left us starving for some comfort food. Upon arriving we needed to remind the hostess that we were in fact a party of 3 adults and 2 children. She managed to forget and yet ask us any possible combination before showing us to the table (2 adults, 3 kids, etc). After getting the children settled we realized it was at least 15 minutes before being greeted by the wait staff. Since we had plenty of time, when our waitress showed up we were ready to place our order. Two kids cheese pizza, salad and two pasta dishes. Not customization or allergy request - should have been easy ask for the chefs. Two bread deliveries and 40 minutes later the waitress informed us the kitchen lost the order. Please remember I noted we had 2 children. They were becoming tired and hungry.  Stunned and hungry we then provided the order to the waitress for the SECOND time hoping the evening would be improved. The manager apologized, brought over some avocado egg rolls and promised a 10 minute meal delivery. Clock was officially at 1 hour 5 minutes.  Thirty five minutes later we were storming out of the restaurant after the waitress returned the THIRD time asking us what we ordered. It is completely unacceptable for the wait staff AND management to treat its customers this way when the issue could have easily been mitigated.  The easiest solution to preventing our misfortune was to simply deliver the food we asked for. The management took no responsibility to follow up to ensure the meal was delivered in tact. Delivering an appetizer and assuming the service has been recovered is not acceptable. The fact that we were so close to the kitchen means that there is little excuse for why the staff could not ensure we received our meal.  Two hours later and a dozen excuses more, we left with some food in hand after demanding it be made 'to-go' after scolding the manager and waitress. Words cannot express how furious and disappointed we are.

Waited 10 min to be seated which wasn't too bad on a Saturday then we get seated and no one greeted our table or even acknowledged we were there horrible server we ended up leaving my kids were bummed out

I haven't to CPK in years and won't be going back anytime soon. Went last night and the service was terrible. We were a party of 8 stuck in a corner and we had to ask for bread several times. Waitress rarely came by we had to go find her a couple of times. One of our orders was completely forgotten. Asked for separate checks when we sat down, got one bill at the end. Food was good though.

Waited 15 minutes before anyone even came to greet us. The pizza was cold, and our favorite Thai crunch salad was wilted and dry. We love CPK and this was by far the worst experience we have had at any location.

Bad service. 10 plus minute wait for setting up a table for 10. The hostess was successful making us feel discrimibated-Asians are not welcome at this location. We had to leave before ordering since no one cared to show up at our table after 8 plus minutes.

Love the CPK! First time went to this one was visiting out of town and have to say the location of the CPK is in a very fancy place. The waiters were very very nice, one found a smudge on my water glass and got me a knew one hahah I started to feel very special, but truth be told I didn't mind the smudge. So wasn't sure if all customers are treated excellently by the CPK staff or if they thought we were fancy people but I def enjoyed the pampering!  Never have had a problem with any CPK so happy to give this place 5 stars! Thanks CPK staff for making me feel special :P

Where is the service? I say this as we sit at the bar waiting once again. Place is about half way full. We sat at the bar because of the view and for 15 minutes we were surrounded by dirty dishes. I had to ask twice before the 3 girls behind the counter chit chatting could be bothered with a drink order or clearing the dishes. Everything is taking way too long and aloof to customers but seems a great place to hang out with coworkers.

Let me start by saying, OUTSTANDING service! I'm in shock their current rating isn't higher. Every time me and my bf go we agree that it's refreshing to eat at a place which understands the importance of top notch service. Tonight was valentine's day and no different. Our waitress was Raeanne and she never let our drinks hit the bottom. In addition, she had a happy attitude, not showing any sign of her busy night. We had pork wongton's  for the appetizer, a full caesar salad, the works pizza with half Hawaiian, and for dessert the "to die for" chocolate soufflé. We weren't let down and will be going back.
Eh. It's CPK. Over priced thin pizza. Service is alright. At least this one is at a nice area.
Great experience and the food is always good. My favorite is the original BBQ Chicken pizza...I add pepperoni to mine. Very very tasty!

Only complaint is about the terrible chefs at this location. Salads came out bland and without flavor. Pizzas had almost no cheese or toppings. Chicken also bland, and dry. Service was good though but it can't make up for the food.
The curbside pick up process needs improvement.  It would be easier to go inside and pick it up it's supposed to make things more convenient but you end up waiting longer and longer
Love a good California Pizza Kitchen.  Although I went during the off season in Palm Desert, the restaurant was running at full capacity.  Very attentive service and the food is ALWAYS fabulous.

I keep seeing bad reviews about  the service and all i gotta say we had a good experience here today. We had israel as a server and he was very nice. Our fiod took a little long, they ran out of artichoke dip appetizer but overall food was good, service was good.

Would not recommend this to anyone. Went for an a Sunday lunch and drinks and our bill was $70 for salads and martinis. The martinis were half full, atleast an inch from the top of not 2 Inches for $9 a piece and very water downed. The size difference between a half salad and a full salad was a couple pieces of chicken and $5 more. And what confused us most is why on the menu pricing was different that the actually bill....don't mind spending no money on a good lunch but this had no flavor what so ever and the drinks were terrible. Would not recommend wasting your time or money!

I like California Pizza Kitchen's Pizzas, especially topping we cannot see at other pizza restaurants. Only problem is its service. It totally depends on who is your waitress/waiter. In order to reduce stress, I get takeout pizzas from CPK.
Great place and who doesn't love hanging out on El Paseo.  I have been to other CPK and this one by far as the best atmosphere....fun place to go.

We noticed California Pizza Kitchen is going down hill on El Paseo. Server is slow. Served ice tea never asked if we required sweetener. Took forever to take our order. Dumplings were not thoroughly cooked, in fact we didn't finish them, they were gummy. I hope my salad is better. We commented before coming about the consistency at California Pizza Kitchen NO MORE. Place 1/3 full and we waited at least 15 minutes for our entree. You would  think the server would ask when picking up a half eaten appetizer "was every thing ok" nope not a word.

YUM! Nothing like thin crust pizza, done in the flaming oven! Love the ambiance of this place, very bright, modern and pleasing to the eye. They have some cool artwork too, Palm Springs style. Classy enough for a date night and always lots of parking right in front on El Paseo. Adore the Thai pizza and the strawberry shortcake dessert! They also had surprisingly great coffee?! Great service, and one of my new fav spots on El Paseo!

Came in while visiting the area, August 3rd, a Monday night, 8pm. The place was wide open but was asked to wait for a table. Instead of being seated in the dining room, my two kids and I were seated in the enclosed bar area. One employee took our drink order, another one brought us our drinks, one waitress took our food order, a different one brought us our food. Food was fine but the service was a little weird.

Went there for lunch today. Service at the door war prompt and excellent. We were seated right away. However, our waitress was horrible. She came to take our order quickly, but we had to ask for bread. It took quite a log time for her to bring out our food, so long that another staff member brought it to us. After that, she did not come to check on us, OR refill our drinks a single time. What kind of waitress are you? It also took quite a long time for her to even ask us if we were ready to get the check. Horrible. Food is good, but I'll be taking my food to-go from here on out.

The food was as we expected, the frozen strawberry lemonade was amazing, service fell really, really  short.  We ordered an appetizer and a frozen strawberry lemonade to start. About 10 minutes later we asked what gin they had available, and had an awkward gin/jim/gym confrontation. Our waitress, who when I said "do you have tanqueray?" presented us with a white wine list. When she came back to take my "tanqueray rocks" order, I was given a tanqueray and tonic. Close....I guess. We were two of maybe 30 people in a 100 capacity restaurant, so why did it take 20 minutes to serve an incorrect drink? It was very out of character for a chain restaurant that prides itself on consistency.
Great food, great service. Teresa was our server and she was great!

The restaurant entrance is through a beautiful flowering are and a mini lake. Inside we were met by smiling workers who has us seated in a minute.  We all got the center table for seven. The order comes in pretty fast. The server was in full stem and constantly refilling drinks, forget refilling he would leave a new glass just in case you finished your drink. The food everyone ordered piazzas which of course come to perfection. Most of us ordered the lemonade or ice -tea people are not drinking soda. In the end had cheese cake. This is a beautiful location for the parking you have to walk a little and the temperature today was 109. We all promised them to return again. My food was a salmon takeout.
Serves from Rosie was awesome, the mushroom and spinach pizza was so good!!and walking up El Paseo Dr is nice.

Just horrible.  I dined with my family Christmas Eve and meal was a disaster from start to finish.  The server however did discount the wine that she brought out by mistake (and replaced with what we did order!)  My son waited 1/2 hr. for his mac and cheese after we had all eaten.  Pizzas were cold, soggy.  Manager didn't even bother to come to the table when we asked to talk to her.  She did glare over at us though.  I took the time to write a detailed letter to their head office and they didn't even bother to get back to me.  Overall I gave this company  too much credit for caring about loyal customers.
great cobb salad ok california pizza  been there done that

Loved our dinner!! Went for dinner with the husband, and the Mom, I hadn't been here in over 10 years. We ordered from a cute appetizer menu, where they had smaller dishes, how nice!! We started with the chips and a sort of corn & pepper guacamole that was Delicious.  Mom ordered a half Chinese chicken salad, which was still pretty good size! She really liked it. The Husband and I split the tequila chicken pasta & a pizza with veggies & pepperoni. The pasta was was SOOO good we talked about it for days after, the flavors were just amazing. The pizza was our least favorite part of the meal, it was tasty, but it just seemed to not be cooked enough...it needed a bit more golden brown.... Our server (Alicia..I think) was very attentive, informed, and friendly. Over all we really enjoyed our evening and our dinner here, we will be back again soon!!

For pizza I usually order the Caribbean jerk pizza, but it seems as if it's only offered in thin crust now. Now we order the Hawaiian bbq pizza, and it is pretty good, but still not the best pizza on El Paseo. Their Gluten-Free crust is OK, and much better if you eat the pizza there than when I get take-out pizza. Salads here are on point though! I recommend the original bbq chicken salad with no cheese and add avocado. The portion is big enough for two people to share.
The WORST service in the desert! We were going to eat in the bar area, but the two bartenders were so busy reading the manual for how to use the computer after 15 minutes we left.  Never going back,!

Let's start with the food.  As far as that part is concerned, they seem to have that part down pretty well.  I had a Hawaiian Pizza, added mushrooms and opted for the wheat crust.  It was nice and crispy, light, but filling.  Flavors meshed very well.  My dining companion had the Caesar salad with the grilled chicken breast.  He seemed to enjoy it, except there were issues with their choice of cutlery.  The fork seemed to be making it challenging to stab those darned pieces of chicken and lettuce.  Are they worried of someone suing them for making the forks normally sharp and accidentally shanking themselves or others around the table?... or maybe the employees?  Who knows, but my friend was having a hard time getting his salad in his mouth.  Sharper forks, please?  Now, as far as the staff is concerned... this may be a symptom of the over-corporatizing of America in general, but two of the employees, including the hostess and one of the servers seemed to be pulled out of the movie "The Truman Show".  Their niceties and verbal interactions with us came across as over-scripted, kind of forced and disingenuous.  Is it their employee training sessions? Too much emphasis on "going above and beyond"? Just plain scripting to the point of coming across as a bad Disney movie?  Who knows, and maybe that's what the clientele there expects (to be ass-kissed to the point of feeling like the emperor with new clothes), but to a visitor from the middle class suburbs who keeps it real and isn't very tolerant of BS or brown nosing, it felt like being fed an overly sweet cake with too much Splenda and a jelly filling made with fairy poops.  Tone it down guys, and just keep it real.

So we went CPK for my family's birthday dinner tonight. It's been a while since we stopped going there because of bad services. Tonight's waiter was Jessie who did such a superb service to make everyone's needs met with a smile! Food was good and great service! Now I'm going back to CPK again!

My wife and I had a wholly un-inspiring visit here. I hate to bullet-point the place, but it really doesn't deserve my prose. * The booths for two (which we were seated in) are too small, especially if both people order a pizza. * This was the loudest restaurant I've been to in the Coachella Valley. It must have something to do with the acoustics of the place, because they weren't packed or anything, but I felt like our table was on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange. * My wife's "Spaghetini" (if that's how it's spelled) was bland. I'm not sure why there was a "tini" on the end. It didn't come with a martinin, or anything. * The waiter warned me that my Habañero Cilantro pizza was really spicy, but that the really hot stuff comes on the side. Once our food came, I had to ask him to bring the sauce, as he had forgotten. The flavor of the pizza was passable, at best. * Did I mention that it was LOUD? * When we were done eating, we asked for 1) a glass of water, 2) a box for leftovers, 3) an accounting of a gift card (which had ~$7-$8 left on it), and 4) the check. What we received: 1) a box for leftovers, 2) a report that the gift card had a zero balance, along with an explanation that perhaps it had expired (huh? isn't that against the law?), and 3) someone else's check, sitting several tables away. We didn't expect the waiter to remember the water, so we weren't disappointed. * At the booth next to us, their avocado egg role appetizer was delivered as they were about half-way through their meal, along with an apology that they had "run out." With the plethora of pizza places scattered all over the Valley, there is no reason why anyone should subject themselves to CPK.

CPK is always consistently delicious! I wasn't feeling well and ordered through LA Bite to have it delivered. I've always eaten inside the restaurant and was apprehensive on what to expect on a delivery- would the pizza and pasta be as good as it is in house? Would the soup not be as I remembered? When the order arrived I was happy to see- and taste the hot pizza and pasta piping hot and delicious! Even the soup was in a container that held the heat and the flavors were all there. I always love coming to CPK and now I know that I can order delivery and it will be just as good!

This CPK has extremely bad service!!!  We had a horrible experience and so did many others as we saw the manager approach the tables around us (in addition to ours) apologizing.  I have never seen that happen before in any restaurant.  There must be a very big problem with management & kitchen staff.  I ordered the new ribeye steak and specifically asked for it well done but when it came to our table there was blood on the plate and the steak was red/raw inside!!  Also, they ran out of food, service was VERY SLOW (took 45 minutes to get our food & a long time to get our drinks too!) and this was a weeknight!  Hopefully they will find a way to improve things in order to avoid customers having to experience such fiascos!

Stopped off for lunch. Ate at the bar. Service ok. Hispanic young female manager was a bit on the foolish side. Ordered Thai chicken salad, waitress asked if I wanted avocado, I said yes. Got about half an avocado on my salad and an additional $4 on my bill. Friend ordered a ham and cheese sandwich on flat bread. Served open faced 4 pieces of bread with about 2 thin slices of ham and some sprinkled cheese atop for $9. No chips, potato salad, nothing. Wouldn't even consider it an appetizer. Disappointing on how cheap this place is with their food. Wont be back. Better off at the food court at the Westfield Mall.

Really bummed about a recent take out service, I was quoted a certain time to be there for curb side pickup. I arrived 10 min. early. Waited a bit & began to call several times with no answer. Finally got through to let them know I was at their designated curb side pick up area. Another 10 min of nothing. Finally a very nice staff member came out to assist me (without my order)& informed me the phone lines were down.Still not sure why the other person I spoke to over 10 min.ago did'nt have some one send my food out right away since they were all ready late on the pick up time quote. Then the person who took my initial phone order did not take it down in exact detail, I was missing items, and my pizza was not made how I specified. I should have checked the food out in the car. I drove right home after I finally got it the pizza was cold and dry. The crust was hard & actually was painful to chew. Really a disappointment. I love a few of their specialty pizzas this last visit was just not satisfying at all, sorry guys  I expect a high dose of quality with everything CPK does, and lets out if their kitchen to their customers including take out customers. Please work on the quoted times too,not fair to send items out so late.

Food was okay but horribly slow service. It took around 35 after ordering for my half a Caesar salad to be made and once I started eating I had flies attacking my food!  The staff was friendly but didn't pay attention to any of the customers.

Your typical CPK dining experience.  The restaurant was clean and the staff was friendly. It was a particularly busy Saturday, but the waiter was attentive and kept drinks refilled.  Can't go wrong with a sandwich or salad here during lunch.

Let's just say no where near the original CPK.   They changed the bread hard chewy crust and tasteless.  They automatically bring oil you have to ask for butter.   Had the lunch special. 7" pizza and Cesar salad. They bring the dressing on the side and trying to toss it the lettuce ended up all over the table and the plate plus not enough to cover the lettuce.   Staff was friendly, atmosphere was still noisy and decor is completely different not sure the green material and walls are that soothing.  Gave it another try was told they were better now, but probably won't be returning unless it's for a fundraiser.  Pretty average food.

Just went tonight and the food was really good!  I got the full Caesar Salad and my wife got the California Veggie Pizza.   A gentleman was walking around asking use to take a survey and we got a $5 off next visit coupon.   Only reason why it is 4 stars is because our witness forgot our bread and over poured my water and it spilled on the ground.

CPK. What is there to say? they're a franchise and they make pretty good pizzas. Only problem is that I feel it's a bit overrated. So I went to this CPK because I was in Palm Springs for a mini vacation and after a whole morning of walking on an empty stomach, my friend wanted CPK. Sure, why not. I was looking forward to ordering my usual which is the carne asada pizza... but it was no where to be found! I was sad.. but I'm assuming that they don't have it because of the demographics.. sounds like a good reasoning. Anywho.. our server was nice, my mango mojito was even nicer annnndd... my thai pizza was aiiight; could have been better but it was still filling. BUT! Their red velvet cake was deliciousssss...

Thanks  for giving our family such AMAZING SERVICE. Took our order and had our drinks and bread in less then a minute. He was very Attentive and  Genuinely friendly we will definitily be coming back. Keep up the Great work!! :)

What can I say about our newly renovated CPK? I haven't visited in over 10 years, but I don't ever remember loving it as much I as I did on my visit last Saturday. We went in for lunch and were pleasantly greeted by the staff and were well taken care of by our server, Sierra. She was fantastic!  We sat at a window table and shared the Creamy Pesto Penne w/ Sundried Tomatoes, and the 5-Cheese and Tomato Pizza. Both went beyond our expectations. The penne was creamy and flavorful and the sundried tomatoes were a wonderful compliment to the pesto. The pizza crust was done perfectly and the creaminess of the cheeses caused for a very satisfied diner.  The only complaint I could possibly give was that the restaurant was freezing cold, and it's impossible to sit anywhere that doesn't have an A/C vent above you. This just reminds me to bundle up for my next visit... And yes... I'll be back soon!   Thank you for the great experience and for reintroducing me to CPK, Sierra!
I come here so much, my favorite waiter Doug knows it by heart. Food never disappoints, from the steak to alll their pizza choices. Chocolate souffle always leaves me satisfied.

Came here on my vacation and I thought the service was pretty spectacular!  Always around to fill up my water, service was quick, food was great, and as a first time experience they gave us free flatbread!

We came here tonight for a family date night. We were waited on by Gio who is an awesome server! He made sure our 2 year old princess always had apple juice and was very attentive with us. Great food, great service, will be back for sure!

Love the food!! Hate the service!!  From the moment you walk in...no one at the front.. All the staff eating and maybe 1-2 employee's actually working!  Most of the times we come there are only max 3 tables eating and one of them being employees. You would think they have time to serve you but they are never around to ask for things and get refills! No urgency... It feels like ALL the servers are new untrained young kids serving for the first time.  I love the menu and keep coming back for torture. My family eats out at ALL the restaurants at least 4 times a week here in Coachella Valley. We visit CPK at least once every 2 weeks but this time I waited almost a month and when we arrived today..... Some guy that I never met before said " welcome back" then the waitress who I have never met before said " you are regulars!l Seems to me they have talked about my family and were prepared to screw us again! My first impression of the waitress was that she had it together!! And was beating me to my Questions.. Obviously she was schooled!!  We asked for bread since it wasn't offered and it has never been since they changed their policy at CPK. She returned with drinks and then said " oh they are making a new batch of bread and it will be awhile." We waited and waited and saw another waiter take bread to another table and then we waited and waited and finally grabbed another waiter and asked him.... He helped us and no waitress around for at least another 10min. Then our main course came out by a food runner and no waitress to get cheese, refills on drinks or extra sauce! No one around again then we saw the same waiter that helped us just minutes ago and asked him!!! He delivered everything we asked again!!  So at the end of another horrific visit, I went ahead and gave our assigned waitress a smaller tip and the remaining 20% to the other server who was attentive and more of a service than our own assigned waitress.  After many bad experiences here... I will NOT return and hope that a secret shopper will come though, a executive at corporate or someone that can make a change here.  This location is top notch and for this location to not have a top notch crew doesn't make sense and it's it's time for an overhaul of employees!!

My daughter and her boyfriend had dinner there on October 11.  She used a debit card and, as she is in the service business, left a cash tip.  The server took it upon them self to add $5.00 to the $35.62 tab.  Pretty crumby, don't you think?

I'm a big fan of CPK, but last night was my first time at this location.  It being off season, the options for dinner after 8pm are very limited in the area, but my boyfriend and I were happy to see that CPK on El Paseo is open till 10 or 11 every night.  We got there at 9pm and immediately were greeted by the friendly staff, who never made us feel rushed.  Our waitress was lovely, and she gave some great recommendations, such as getting pita bread with our spinach artichoke bread.  When they felt the pita wasn't 100% perfect (just because it had a whole from being baked...) they gave us a 2nd one free.  We split a Moroccan salad, the dip, and  BBQ chicken pizza.  everything was delicious, and the portions were so large that I had lunch for the next day.   After an amazing late night dinner, we left happy and were talking about how we needed to come back soon.  Its so nice to have the reliability of a chain restaurant but to feel like its just a really good neighborhood spot.

We visit from Los Angeles a few times a month and always eat here. The location is excellent, the staff is friendly and the food is excellent!!  From the tap beer, salads, pizza and desert, all is always good.

Came here on Presidents' Day and it was packed for a Monday!  I started off with the Caribbean Sunset sangria that was SO GOOD. Then I had the asparagus and arugula salad that was so so, I wish it had just a touch more Parmesan on it. The lettuce wraps we had were so good, it was gone in 5 minutes haha. My Pesto Cream Penne with chicken was so flavorful, I'd totally order it again.  I dropped it down to 4 stars is because our server came back for refills once and left our pretty small table for 5 ridden with all our empty glasses and never cleared them to make room, even though I neatly lined them up on the edge of the table for an easy grab for him.  Regardless, we had a great time and the food was good.

Karissa was amazing tonight! She's a fantastic server - friendly, attentive, conversational without being intrusive. Our food was great, too - I had the half Roasted Veggie Salad with Shrimp, my husband had the Mahi Mahi Tacos, and my 7-year-old had the cheese pizza. Everyone was super happy with the quality and quantity of food. The atmosphere was perfect, too - vibrant and lively without being too loud to have a conversation with the family during dinner. We'll be back!

Returned recently and the food was very very good! New items, the place looks cool and the vibe was energetic.  The redo looks likes it's going well and the food is certainly trending the right direction as well. It's clear they needed to step up their game to compete against newly opened competitors nearby.  Trisha was great..... especially compared to the last, very very grumpy angry person that seemed to almost enjoy being rude to customers. #noideawhy #zerosumgain It was nice to meet a lovely person such as Trisha. #funtrisha

30 minute wait for a salad???  Wow!  While waiting at the bar, I spoke to a server who was sitting next to me on break.  I asked him "are you really busy right now", he answered "no, not at all".  Turns out the lady dealing with takeout got distracted and had forgotten to tell me that it was ready.  Really bad service.

A friend and I went in on Tuesday, and Betty was our server.  Not only was the food very good, but Betty was a five star server.  Will ask for her on my next visit I had the warm salad over mixed greens.  Food was great.  Thought you should know.

Came in with my kids after a day of Xmas shopping and the food was great!! The atmosphere was awesome. My daughter ordered a pizza and raved couldn't believe how good it was. My son got a chicken club and for a picky eater there was nothing he didn't like about it.  The service we got was tops!!

I just completed a six hour hike up route 74 and had been thinking about a chicken Caesar salad from Cpk the whole time. I went to pick it up at this location and bring it home to Palm Springs. Everything going smoothly, now that I am home I pull out, what? You ask? The complete wrong order and w a dressing I'm allergic to, to boot. I'd be just really annoyed if this didn't happen almost every single time I used to order at the Palm Springs location when they were still around. Now I just feel like saying shame on me for thinking it'd be any different.  On the upside, the manager was very gracious and professional with my complaint  and hopefully I'll see the credit on my CC he offered to me. My only advice is to not trust the waitstaff and to suggest better training or more severe punishment for idiot moves like tonight.  YOU. HAVE. ONE. JOB!

Waited at least 20 min for anyone to come and even offer us water! From there, our waitress was somewhere in space. She got our drinks all messed up and forgot two then got our food order wrong. The only hope for this place is that the menu is the same at each one so it is pretty hard to mess up the food... Or so we thought...The Thai crunch salad had yellow cabbage ..... So disappointing. Safe to say the family is never coming here again.

Poor service, mediocre food. Won't go back & won't recommend. That about sums it up. They tried to make it up to us by comping some of our drinks but the credit card copy of the bill was still for the full amount so we had to change it by hand. I'll be watching for the transaction to show up on my bill.

ordered jambalaya for to go! I specifically asked for low salt but the meal still came out very salty!  the meal was just ok!  nothing exciting to talk about!  if I don't have too, I probably won't come back

Once singles decide to come into couple units and then spawn into family units, I imagine the restaurants they patronize are family restaurants. Boring, chains since the kids rule the eating choices! *le sigh* I ordered the chicken tequila fettuccine because I was craving spice. I also ordered a small salad to share with the table.  The menu includes pasta, fish, and salads in addition to pizzas.  The size of my dish was actually quite manageable.  I was expecting a super sized ridiculous dish, but instead, I received a regular person sized dish. All in all, the food was palatable.

What??? No more Santa Fe Chicken pizza! We have been coming to this restaurant for years.  It's one of two (Tommy Bahamma's being the other) we hit when we are traveling between LA/SD and Scottsdale.  It's sort of a half way stop for us -- not quite but it feels that way. Typical CPK in every respect.  Friendly service, warm sourdough bread, great salads (though we tend to always order the Chopped Salad) and tasty pizza.  Sadly, as we note above, CPK no longer offers the Santa Fe Chicken. Too bad!  But the Hawaii BBQ, Garlic Chicken, Jamaican Jerky, Five Cheese & Fresh Tomato are all very good.  Enjoy!

It's definitely more expensive than any other CPK'S and I've been to plenty. This one is very beautiful and has great service.  A few nights it took awhile to get our entrées but the appetizers and drinks came out quick every single time. There was an occasion where we sat at the bar section and when we asked our server about a drink on the menu.. she gave her opinion and recommended to substitute something for another. We did. And it was an extra $7 charge! We weren't aware it would cost extra let alone a whole other drink. We each got this drink and it cost us between $27-32 for both. A bit ridiculous. I confronted her when we got the check and she said "Well the substitute is a whole other alcohol so it's like ordering another drink but just mixed into one." My reaction, "Had we known this was the case, we would've just got the original and not your recommendation and then got the other drink as our second. So at least we are enjoying 2 drinks instead of one $16+ drink." She didn't budge and I asked to talk to the manager. He sided with the server and we still paid. Our issue was with not being told that her recommendatuon would cost more than 2 drinks for just 1.  I still gave it 4 stars instead of less since I haven't seen both the manager lately.  Nobody likes sneaky servers. Or matching managers.

This is based on LA Bite delivery yesterday. The food arrived on time. It was all COLD--not even lukewarm. I complained and am supposed to get a full credit...we'll see if that happens. The very thin ribeye wasn't a ribeye. I don't know what it was, but it was tough, fatty, and gristly. It was rare, though, as I had ordered. Fingerling potatoes were passable but dry. The "arugula salad" wasn't arugula and it wasn't dressed. Just dry, mysterious greens. The best part was the bread, but I had to provide my own butter--no biggie, but I thought I'd mention it. For about $40, this was a total rip-off. I guess I should go back to cooking my own meals.
After returning again, I am reminded the reason we come back is Meagan. Thanks for great service and care!

After a day of not so great shopping, we topped it off with a great dinner. The food was fresh and tasted great. I was surprised that for such an upscale area, the prices seem just like any other CPK.  Great place to take the family and have some healthy fare.
Nothing special. But highly dependable. WILD! Mushroom pizza is a favorite.  So too, the Moroccan Chicken Salad.

SO thank you to the gm for attempting to fix our issues at the restaurant, I contacted corporate and they responded a week later to remedy our situation, being in food and beverage myself I had a heavy heart about this extreme situation and I hope it is a one time experience that will never repeat so we're going to give cpk another chance... thank you for the outlet to express our concerns ... lets try this again, the food was great and I hope it all goes as planned this next visit

New decor ! Wrot iron chairs with hard wood seats and low backs . No more comfy booths. Industrial look.  Bath rooms now have plastic trough sink with air peer dryer for hands. Reminds me of the rest areas on the side of major freeways.  Folds still tasty . This should add to there ToGoOrder biz . Interesting to see if there stock prices drop over the next couple of years . As the clientele declines .

Haven't been here in a while but I'm glad I came back. They have made some positive changes in their menu and in the restaurant itself. I shared a half Caesar salad with my husband and it was definitely big enough. I had the Hawaiian pizza and it was delicious. My husband had the artichoke spinach pizza and added chicken and he enjoyed it very much. Our waiter, Jesse, had a great personality and was very attentive. Next time I'm in Palm Springs I will definitely be going back.

So, let me start by saying the food was very good. We had the petite wedge, fennel sausage flatbread, and the garlic cheese fettuccine. All were good.  Our server was an odd gentleman. He approached the table and seemed very nice. Immediately I noticed the Cheesecake Factory check presenter he used to write down orders. When I mentioned it, he said, "that's my other job. I like it better than the ones they have here and I like the ordering pad better from Cheesecake Factory too."  Weird, and unprofessional. I would imagine the California Pizza kitchen brand managers would not be happy. As the meal continued, our waiter was more and more strange. When my petite wedge salad arrived, he said, "you know who has a great wedge salad?  Outback. It has the blue cheese dressing but they add the balsamic also. It's so good." So the Cheesecake Factory employee who works at California pizza kitchen is now hyping the food at yet another restaurant. I can't keep it straight.

Just stopped by for lunch while visiting a friend from San Diego. The food was excellent, prices were great (even for a student like myself) and our waitress Taylor was so sweet and funny. Will definitely be back next visit!
